randomunit

Class SimpleLogStrategy

  • java.lang.Object
    • randomunit.SimpleLogStrategy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LogStrategy

    public class SimpleLogStrategy
extends Object
implements LogStrategy
    A simple LogStrategy implementation that maintains a single log buffer, for every method invocation. The length of the buffer is bounded at an arbitrary value.
    Author:
    Andreou Dimitris, andreou < at > csd dot uoc dot gr

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SimpleLogStrategy(int bufferLength)
      Creates an instance of this class, given the maximum allowable length of the internal buffer.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void appendLog(MethodInvocationLog entry)
      Appends an execution log.
      String dump()
      Returns a textual representation of the log entries (possibly truncated) in this LogStrategy.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimpleLogStrategy

        public SimpleLogStrategy(int bufferLength)
        Creates an instance of this class, given the maximum allowable length of the internal buffer. When the buffer is full, for each new entry logged, the earliest entry is removed.
        Parameters:
        bufferLength - the maximum length of the log buffer. Must be >= 0

    • Method Detail

      • dump

        public String dump()
        Description copied from interface: LogStrategy
        Returns a textual representation of the log entries (possibly truncated) in this LogStrategy. This is used for the messages of exceptions thrown by a randomized test.
        Specified by:
        dump in interface LogStrategy

      • appendLog

        public void appendLog(MethodInvocationLog entry)
        Description copied from interface: LogStrategy
        Appends an execution log. The test method that was executed is provided, its arguments, and the returned value.
        Specified by:
        appendLog in interface LogStrategy
